alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 26 at 10:18PM PST until December 27 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 45 to 55 mph expected. An initial round of strong wind will occur between now and 1 AM Tuesday. The strongest winds will be between 6 AM and Noon Tuesday. A few gusts to 60 mph are possible on the higher terrain, such as the Chehalem Mountains north of Newberg. Winds will become westerly later in the afternoon, and gradually ease into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia, Greater Portland Metro Area, Central Willamette Valley and South Willamette Valley. In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs and isolated trees could be blown down and scattered power outages are likely.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County
